edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.damgardJurikEncryptedValue

Class SigmaDJEncryptedValueProverInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.damgardJurikEncryptedValue.SigmaDJEncryptedValueProverInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SigmaProverInput, ZKProverInput

    public class SigmaDJEncryptedValueProverInput
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaProverInput
    Concrete implementation of SigmaProtocol input, used by the SigmaDamgardJurikEncryptedValueProver.

    In SigmaProtocolDamgardJurikEncryptedValue, the prover gets DamgardJurikPublicKey, BigIntegerCiphertext, BigIntegerPlaintext and the random BigInteger used to encrypt.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

        cipher - encryption on the given plaintext.
        plaintext - that has been encrypted.

      • SigmaDJEncryptedValueProverInput

        public SigmaDJEncryptedValueProverInput(DamgardJurikPublicKey publicKey,
                                BigIntegerCiphertext cipher,
                                BigIntegerPlainText plaintext,
                                DamgardJurikPrivateKey privateKey)
        This protocol assumes that the prover knows the randomness used to encrypt.

        If the prover knows the secret key, then it can compute (once) the value m=n^(-1) mod phi(n)=n^(-1) mod (p-1)(q-1).

        Then, it can recover the randomness r from c by computing c^m mod n (this equals r^(n/n) mod n = r).

        Once given r, the prover can proceed with the protocol.

        Parameters:
        publicKey - used to encrypt.
        cipher - encryption on the given plaintext.
        plaintext - that has been encrypted.
        privateKey - used for decrypt.
